headline: DNA evidence leads investigators to suspect in 30-year-old cold case
author: WXII12.com Web Staff
sentences: Special agents from the North Carolina State Bureau of Investigation Cold Case Unit and investigators from the Surry County Sheriff’s Office started re-examining physical evidence in the case in April 2021, according to a news release.
Fitzpatrick said the technology has a wide range of applications, but that it is particularly useful in cold case investigations using DNA evidence.
Investigators said Thursday the Surry County Sheriff's Office was in the process of extraditing Alexander back to North Carolina.

SURRY COUNTY, N.C. —
A man from Mississippi is charged with murder in the death of a woman in North Carolina 30 years ago.
Investigators worked with Dr. Colleen Fitzpatrick, founder of Identifiers International LLC, on the case.
Investigators said DNA evidence led agents to identify Warren Luther Alexander as a suspect.
Alexander is being held at the Hancock County Jail awaiting extradition to North Carolina.
Fitzpatrick said the company specializes in forensic genetic genealogy.
Officers arrested Alexander in Diamondhead, Mississippi, on Tuesday.
Investigators are looking into whether there are more victims.
"It’s an extraordinary gift to bring peace to these families.
Scott Hudson estimated that could happen within the week.
Nona Stamey Cobb was found dead on July 7, 1992.
I wish we could do it for all the cases."
